Major_Arcs.title: Page 1-2: Alley Oop's Initial Encounters and Dinny's Age
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Alley Oop and King Guz, setting up Alley's character through a rescue and a debt collection. It then shifts to Dinny, Alley's dinosaur, and his increasing clumsiness due to old age.

sub_scenes.title: King Guz's Rescue and Debt
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene encompasses King Guz's dramatic rescue by Alley Oop and the immediate, opportunistic follow-up where Alley demands repayment of an old debt, revealing Alley's pragmatic and slightly opportunistic nature.

sub_scenes.title: Dinny's Clumsiness and Age
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Dinny's increasing clumsiness, evidenced by him bumping into trees. It introduces the theme of Dinny's old age and wear, setting up potential future narrative developments regarding Dinny's condition.

Major_Arcs.title: Page 3-6: Dinny's Potential Replacement and Mishaps
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc deals with the consideration of replacing Dinny due to his age and clumsiness. It follows Alley's visit to a dinosaur dealership, the test drive of a new dinosaur, and the unfortunate incident where the new dinosaur bites Dinny, leading to complaints and further reflection on Dinny's future.

sub_scenes.title: Considering Dinny's Replacement
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene starts with the suggestion to replace Dinny and Alley's initial consideration of this idea, driven by Dinny's age-related issues.

sub_scenes.title: Shopping for a New Dinosaur
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Alley and Man 3 at Honest Zog's dealership, exploring different dinosaur models and test-driving a potential replacement for Dinny.

narrative_arcs.title: Shopping at Honest Zog's Dinosaur Dealership

sub_scenes.title: Dinny Compared and Bitten
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on the comparison of Dinny to a newer, faster dinosaur. It culminates in the new dinosaur biting Dinny, highlighting the downsides of the newer model and the vulnerability of the older Dinny.

narrative_arcs.title: The Zippy Dinosaur's Speed and Dinny's Bite
Complaints at Honest Zog's and the Damaged Tail

Major_Arcs.title: Page 5-7: Dinny's Farewell, Flashback, and Mistreatment
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc covers the emotional farewell to Dinny as Alley decides to trade him in. It includes a flashback to Dinny's training days and then shifts to Dinny being mistreated at the dealership, leading to an intervention and a new bond forming.

sub_scenes.title: Dinny's Farewell and Trade
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows the poignant farewell to Dinny as Alley makes the difficult decision to trade him in, emphasizing Dinny's years of service and the sadness of separation.

narrative_arcs.title: Farewell to Dinny and Decision to Trade
Dinny Offered for Sale at Honest New & Used Dinosaurs

sub_scenes.title: Dinny's Sales Pitch and Test Ride Mishap
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on the sales pitch for Dinny at the dealership and a potential buyer's test ride, which ends in Dinny bumping into a tree, further diminishing his appeal.

narrative_arcs.title: Continuing the Sales Pitch and Price Negotiation
Dinny's Test Ride and Tree Collision
Fall from Dinny, Scolding, and Dinny's Voice

sub_scenes.title: Dinny's Mistreatment and Rescue
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts to Dinny being mistreated by a new owner, leading to an intervention by another man who defends Dinny and forms a bond with him.

Major_Arcs.title: Page 8-12: Romantic Troubles and French Romance Lessons
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc explores various romantic mishaps and misunderstandings. It starts with Coola rejecting Alley, then moves to misogynistic fishermen, romantic competition, and culminates in cavemen learning about 'French romance' to win over women.

sub_scenes.title: Coola's Rejection and Misogynistic Fisherman
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene begins with Coola rejecting Alley's fishing invitation due to his taking her for granted. It then transitions to a misogynistic fisherman complaining about women, showcasing different facets of male-female interactions.

narrative_arcs.title: Rejected Fishing Trip and Unexpected Consequence
Misogynistic Fishermen and Their Noisy Outbursts

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Competition and Investigation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces a romantic rivalry where a caveman suspects another of 'pitching woo' to Oola. It follows their investigation and the eventual shift of romantic interest.

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation, Misunderstanding, and French Romance Advice
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts a violent confrontation fueled by romantic jealousy, a misunderstanding about affection, and the introduction of 'French romance' as a solution.

Major_Arcs.title: Page 13-14: Romantic Gestures and Comical Misunderstandings
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc showcases cavemen attempting romantic gestures, leading to humorous and chaotic outcomes. It includes flower giving, log offering, a crocodile encounter, and a farcical misunderstanding involving hand-kissing and 'finger-eating' accusations.

sub_scenes.title: Competing Romantic Gestures and Crocodile Incident
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts escalating romantic competition using flowers and a log as gifts, culminating in a comical encounter with a crocodile.

narrative_arcs.title: Log as a Bridge and Crocodile Encounter
Reprimand for Vulgarity and Squashed Crocodile

sub_scenes.title: Jealous Rage and Hand-Kissing Misunderstanding
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene features jealous rage leading to a physical confrontation based on a comical misunderstanding about hand-kissing being misinterpreted as 'finger-eating'.

narrative_arcs.title: Clarification and Comical Resolution - Kissing Hand

Major_Arcs.title: Page 15-16: Infidelity, Domestic Disputes, and Dancing Dilemmas
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc covers themes of infidelity and domestic conflict, alongside a shift to dancing and social expectations. It includes accusations of cheating, physical domestic disputes, attempts at romantic reform, and the introduction of the 'Twitch' dance and its consequences.

sub_scenes.title: Infidelity Accusations and Domestic Violence
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene presents scenarios of infidelity accusations, their immediate aftermath, and a stark portrayal of domestic violence as a response to suspected cheating.

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Reformation and Polite Advances
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene showcases an attempt at romantic reformation and a contrasting scene of exaggerated politeness, exploring different approaches to relationships.

sub_scenes.title: The Dangers of the 'Twitch' Dance
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the 'Twitch' dance and its humorous consequences, focusing on injuries and social pressures related to this new dance trend.

Major_Arcs.title: Page 17-18: Alley Learns to Twitch and its Chaotic Results
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Alley's attempt to learn the 'Twitch' dance to appease Oola, leading to a disastrous dance lesson and a frightening demonstration of the dance, culminating in widespread chaos and hospitalizations.

sub_scenes.title: Alley's First (and Disastrous) Dance Lesson
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Alley's first dance lesson, which is fraught with mishaps and injuries, ending with a surprising name reveal from the dance instructor.

sub_scenes.title: The Terrifying 'Twitch' Demonstration and its Aftermath
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Alley demonstrating the 'Twitch', which terrifies onlookers and leads to further comedic humiliation and widespread hospitalizations due to simply watching the dance.

Major_Arcs.title: Page 19-21: Time Travel for Historical Research
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a shift to the 20th century and the theme of time travel for historical research. It involves researchers, a time machine, and the accidental transportation of Alley Oop and Oola to the future and then to ancient Spain.

sub_scenes.title: The Historical Research Dilemma
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene sets up the problem of lack of historical records for 16th century Spain, prompting the researchers to consider time travel as a solution.

narrative_arcs.title: The Dilemma of 16th Century Spanish History

sub_scenes.title: Accidental Time Travel and Spain Assignment
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details the accidental time travel of Alley and Oola to the 20th century, their encounter with Dr. Wonmug, and their subsequent assignment to travel to ancient Spain for research.

narrative_arcs.title: The Kiss Interrupted by Time Travel
The Spain Assignment and Return to the Past

Major_Arcs.title: Page 22-23: Arrival in Spain and Serenade Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Alley Oop and Oola's arrival in medieval Spain and their immediate involvement in a serenade conflict. It involves mistaken identities, physical altercations, and reveals a connection to a famous matador.

sub_scenes.title: Hostile Welcome and Disruptive Serenade
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Alley and Oola's arrival in Spain and their immediate encounter with a disruptive serenade and hostile locals.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival in Medieval Spain and Hostile Welcome
The Serenade and the Dame's Ire
Alley Oop's Intervention and Demand for Manners

sub_scenes.title: Lute Attack, Boyfriend Reveal, and Matador Connection
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Alley's physical intervention in the serenade, Oola's unexpected defense of the serenader as her 'boyfriend', and the revelation that the serenader is a famous matador, escalating the consequences of Alley's actions.

narrative_arcs.title: The Lute Attack and Dame's Annoyance
The Famous Matador and the Manager's Threat

Major_Arcs.title: Page 24-26: Bool-Fight and Return from Spain
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows the aftermath of the matador incident, leading to Alley Oop unexpectedly becoming a toreador in a 'bool-fight'. It concludes with Alley's successful performance, return from Spain, and a jealous argument.

sub_scenes.title: Becoming the Toreador
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details the manager's reaction to Don Jose's injury and the unexpected proposition for Alley Oop to become a novelty toreador.

narrative_arcs.title: Aftermath and Pressure for a Toreador

sub_scenes.title: Bool-Fight Victory and Return
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Alley Oop's surprisingly swift and successful performance in the 'bool-fight', followed by his return from Spain and a promised kiss.

narrative_arcs.title: Alley Oop's Return and Promised Kiss

sub_scenes.title: Jealousy and Unkissed Outcome
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene presents a separate conflict arising from jealousy and accusations of infidelity during the Spain trip, resulting in a man being denied a kiss.

Major_Arcs.title: Page 27-28: King for a Day - A Comical Power Struggle
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc explores the concept of 'King for a Day' and satirizes power and authority. It depicts a caveman initially believing kingship is easy, only to experience the harsh reality of how the 'king' is actually treated, leading to comical abuse and the former king's cynical return to power.

sub_scenes.title: Initial Impression of 'King for a Day'
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the concept of 'King for a Day' and the initial, naive perception that it is an easy and enviable role.

narrative_arcs.title: King for a Day - Initial Impression

sub_scenes.title: The Harsh Reality of Kingship
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene reveals the stark contrast between the perceived ease of kingship and the brutal reality, as the new 'king' is subjected to abuse similar to the former king.

narrative_arcs.title: Royal Proclamation and Former King's Instruction
Reality of Kingship - Mockery and Abuse

Major_Arcs.title: Page 29: King Guz's Domestic Troubles - The Ulcer Pills and Dirty Feet
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on King Guz's domestic life and his conflicts with the Queen. It highlights their contrasting lifestyles and the Queen's domineering nature through comical scenarios involving 'bon-bons' (ulcer pills) and dirty feet.

sub_scenes.title: Queen's Disgust and Broom Attack
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the Queen's angry confrontation with King Guz, triggered by his leisurely indulgence and escalating to a physical attack with a broom over dirty feet.

narrative_arcs.title: King Guz's Leisure and Queen's Disgust
Broom Attack and the Demand to Wash Feet

Major_Arcs.title: Page 30-33: Clams, Conflicts, and King's Resignation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc presents a series of escalating conflicts and power dynamics centered around a king and his subjects. It begins with minor disputes, progresses to the king's self-serving resolution over found clams, and culminates in the king being punched and unexpectedly resigning from his position.

sub_scenes.title: Initial Disputes and King's Clam Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces initial conflicts - cheating accusations and a money fight - followed by the king's intervention and self-serving resolution of a clam dispute.

narrative_arcs.title: Initial Disputes: Cheating and Money Fight
King's Clam Resolution and its Aftermath

sub_scenes.title: Palace Disturbance and King's Dinner
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts a disturbance outside the palace, revealed to be a beating, contrasted with the king's internal focus on his financial wisdom and anticipation of a lavish dinner.

sub_scenes.title: Food Theft, Punch, and King's Resignation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene features a sudden act of food theft from the king's plate, leading to a confrontation, a playful 'peek-a-boo' turning violent with a punch, and ultimately, the king's surprising resignation after accepting an apology.

sub_scenes.title: Looking for a New Ruler
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the search for a new ruler following the previous king's resignation and the initial preparations for the new leader.

Major_Arcs.title: Page 34: The 'Barberous Act' - A Prophecy Fulfilled
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on a prophecy and its humorous fulfillment. It involves a Grand Wizer, a prophecy about a bearded stranger, and the surprising reveal that the 'barberous act' is related to shaving and a barber shop.

sub_scenes.title: The Prophecy and Interruption
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene sets up a prophecy about a bearded stranger and introduces the bearded caveman who seems to fulfill this prophecy, albeit with a forceful interruption.

Major_Arcs.title: Page 35: Time Machine Malfunction - The Roman Soldier
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc concludes the comic narrative by returning to the theme of time travel, but with a humorous twist. It depicts a time machine experiment going wrong, resulting in the unexpected arrival of a Roman soldier and the realization of a malfunction.

sub_scenes.title: Time Machine Experiment and Unexpected Result
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows the setup of a time machine experiment and the surprising materialization of a Roman soldier, indicating an unforeseen outcome.
